revised_title: Enhancing Signal Intensity in Multiple-Quantum Spectroscopy
tldr: This article discusses the use of selective excitation and phase cycling in multiple-quantum spectroscopy to increase signal intensity. The authors demonstrate how incorporating selective excitation into the multiple-quantum Fourier-transform nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) experiment leads to increased signal intensities, particularly in proton NMR of molecules orientated in liquid crystals. The information content of multiple-quantum NMR spectra of dipolar-coupled spins is also compared with the alternative of isotopic labeling experiments.
